official-title.#text:
To honor Larry Holmes for his career and
		  community service on the 35th anniversary of his winning the WBC World
		  Heavyweight Title.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
honors Larry Holmes on the 35th anniversary of his WBC World Heavyweight
			 Championship victory—

text.#text:
for his stellar
			 boxing career; and

for the meaningful
			 community service he has performed throughout his life.

Whereas Larry Holmes is a retired American professional
			 boxer;
Whereas Holmes was born on November 3, 1949;

Whereas Holmes defeated Ken Norton on June 9, 1978, to
			 become the WBC World Heavyweight Champion;

Whereas Holmes won 48 consecutive bouts and retained his
			 title for over 7 years;
Whereas Holmes defeated Muhammad Ali, who is known as

Whereas Holmes finished his career with a record of 69–6
			 and was inducted into the International Boxing Hall of Fame;

Whereas his success has not been limited to the boxing
			 ring;

Whereas his investments in Easton have included many
			 charitable endeavors;

term.#tail:
5-kilometer
			 race has helped raise awareness of physical fitness for 35 years;

text.#text:
Whereas Holmes has received the Jaycee’s National
			 Outstanding Young Man Award;

Whereas the Daughters of the American Revolution awarded
			 Holmes the Medal of Honor for trustworthiness; and

Whereas Holmes has been a pillar of his community: Now,
			 therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 251 IH: To honor Larry Holmes for his career and community service on the 35th anniversary of his winning the WBC World Heavyweight Title.
